Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library Fairfax 24 (SC 3904); London, College of Arms, Arundel 14: not found in this copy of Peter Langtoft’s Chronicle (ff. 133-147); London, British Library Royal 20 A.II: not found in this MS; London, Lambeth Palace Library 131: not in this MS.
_description: The Messenger’s Speech to Balliol, inserted in Peter Langtoft’s Chronicle and Robert Mannyng’s Chronicle — one 6-line stanza (preceded by two French stanzas)

OxfAllS39.Transcription:
On gre[ne]þat kynerede kenegaþered al gaytI
                    weneon summe es it seneware ye byt bayt
OxfAllS39.Note: In Robert Mannyng of Brunne’s Chronicle.

CULGg11.Transcription:
On greneþat kingrede kenegaderid als gaity weneOn
                    sum it is seneware þe bit bait

                        ed.  
             The Political Songs of England.

BLHar114.Transcription:
On grene þat kynrede keneGadret als gaitI wene on summe es

BLRoy20Axi.Transcription:
On þe grene . þat kinred kene . Gadred als þe gaitI
                    wene . On summe is it sene . Whare þe bit bait
BLRoy20Axi.Note: Written as prose. In Peter Langtoft’s Chronicle.

Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             The Political Songs of England.
Camden Society
         o.s. 6 (1839): 293, 393.

InnerTem5117.Transcription:
þer on þat grene þat kynrede kene gadred als þe
                    gayteright als I wene on som was it sene þer þe bit
                    bayte
InnerTem5117.Note:
In Robert Mannyng of Brunne’s Chronicle. Lines 1-2 on
                    folio.
